title.narrative: Technical and financial support of trained radio for the production of content in Mali

description.narrative: As Results: - 18 content (9 magazines and 9 debates) were realized by 9 radios, on the cohort of 15 having benefited from the training, - 70% of the topics developed in productions were related to violence against women and girls in Mali, and more specifically the schooling of girls, and domestic violence. - 58 people participated both in magazines and debates. Among these participants, 35.19% were CSOs’ representatives, 22.22% were decisions-makers, 7% were religious leaders, and 27.28% were school supervisors. - Local radios are raising public debate between local authorities (mayors and sub-divisional officers), teaching staff and grassroots organizations, by initiating discussions on the challenges of schooling girls in rural Mali. - The participation of local decision-makers in these public conversations demonstrates their interest in addressing with local organizations delicate or even taboo issues, such as girls' education and domestic violence, in a context dominated by the radical conservatism that advocates inequality between girls and boys, men and women

In the framework of the partnership with Studio Tamani, local radio stations trained in March 2019 continued to produce magazine and debate-based productions about women in Mali. This is a total of 30 broadcasts (15 debates and 15 magazines) that were to be produced by the 15 radio stations benefiting from the training.
